metadata.title: CVE-2023-52646 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: aio:fix mremap after fork null-deref Commit e4a0d3e720e7 ("aio: Make itpossible to remap aio ring") introduced a null-deref if mremap is called onan old aio mapping after fork as mm->ioctx_table will be set to NULL.[jmoyer@redhat.com: fix 80 column issue]

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52646` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-211-generic - 4.15.0-211.222~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-211-generic - 4.15.0-211.222~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-211-lowlatency - 4.15.0-211.222~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1156-aws - 4.15.0-1156.169~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1165-azure - 4.15.0-1165.180~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1150-gcp - 4.15.0-1150.166~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1119-oracle - 4.15.0-1119.130~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-211.222~16.04.1').
linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1156.169~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1165.180~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1150.166~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1119.130~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
